intro: Notelaea ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed tree fern, is a species native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a unique structure with a fibrous root system and a crown of feathery leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. Notelaea ovata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in tropical and subtropical gardens.
